sen.j: 明治まで浜田城と天領だった石見銀山は長州が制圧した。
sen.e: The Choshu clan conquered the Hamada-jo Castle and Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine, which were shogunal lands until the Meiji Period.
Thus, the Choshu clan conquered the Hamada-jo Castle and Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine, which were shogunal lands until the Meiji period.

sen.j: 小倉口では、総督・小笠原長行が指揮する九州諸藩と高杉晋作、山縣有朋ら率いる長州藩との戦闘（小倉戦争）が関門海峡をはさんで数度行われた。
sen.e: In Kokura-guchi, the alliance of Kyushu domains lead by the governor Nagamichi OGASAWARA fought against the Choshu clan lead by Shinsaku TAKASUGI and Aritomo YAMAGATA a few times across the Kanmon-kaikyo Strait (Ogura War), and at one point the Higo clan fought an even battle (the Battle of Akasaka/Torigoe, near Kitakyushu City Sakuragaoka Primary School).

In Kokura-guchi, the alliance of Kyushu domains lead by the commander Nagamichi OGASAWARA and the Choshu clan lead by Shinsaku TAKASUGI and Aritomo YAMAGATA had several armed contacts across the Kanmon-kaikyo Strait (Ogura War).

sen.j: 一時肥後藩が互角の戦いを見せた（赤坂・鳥越の戦い。現在の北九州市立桜丘小学校付近）。
sen.e: And at one point the Higo clan of the bakufu side fought an even battle (the Battle of Akasaka/Torigoe, near Kitakyushu City Sakuragaoka Primary School).

sen.j: しかし佐賀藩は兵を出さず、小笠原の指揮よろしきを得ず、諸藩は随時撤兵。
sen.e: However, the Saga Domain did not dispatch troops, and OGASAWARA's command was not working, then the domains withdrew their troops whenever they needed.
However, the Saga Domain did not dispatch the troops, the commander Ogasawara's leadership did not work, and the domains of the alliance withdrew their troops one by one.

sen.j: 将軍家茂薨去の報を受けた小笠原も戦線を離脱した。
sen.e: On receipt of the announcement of the decease of the shogun Iemochi, OGASAWARA left the front line.
On receipt of the notice of the shogun Iemochi's disease, the commander Ogasawara also left the front line.
On receipt of the notice of the shogun Iemochi's disease, the commander Ogasawara also left the front line.

sen.j: 孤立した小倉藩は8月1日城に火を放ち香春に退却。
sen.e: The isolated Kokura clan set fire to the castle on August 1, and retreated to Kawara.
The isolated Kokura clan set fire to its own castle on September 9 (表記の変更), and retreated to Kawara.

sen.j: その後も小倉藩と長州藩の戦闘は続くが、これで事実上、幕府軍の全面敗北に終わる。
sen.e: Although the war between the Kokura clan and the Choshu clan continued after that, it practically ended with the total defeat of the army of bakufu.
Although the battle between the Kokura clan and the Choshu clan continued even after that, the Choshu conquest practically ended with the total defeat of the bakufu army.

sen.e: Although the battle between the Kokura clan and the Choshu clan continued even after that, the Choshu conquest practically ended with the total defeat of the bakufu army.

sen.j: 更に戦いの長期化に備えて各藩が兵糧米を備蓄した事によって米価が暴騰し、全国各地で一揆や打ちこわしが起こる原因となった（世直し一揆）。
sen.e: Since each domain stockpiled provisions of rice for the army, the rice price soared, and as a result uprising and destructive urban riots (reform riot) occurred in various places all over Japan.

In addition, since each domain stockpiled the provisions of rice for their army, the rice price soared, and as a result, uprising and destructive urban riots (Yonaoshi Ikki, a series of uprisings calling for social reforms) occurred in various places all over Japan.

sen.j: 徳川慶喜は大討込と称して、みずから出陣して巻き返すことを宣言したが、小倉陥落の報に衝撃を受けて大討込を中止した。
sen.e: Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA declared that he would lead Ouchikomi (a grand attack) and go to the battle himself to roll back; however, he was so shocked by the news of the fall of Kokura that he called off the attack.
Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA declared Ouchikomi (a grand attack) in which he himself would lead the troops to the front, however, the fall of the Kokura clan dispirit him and he called off the attack.

sen.j: 家茂の死を公にしたうえで、朝廷に働きかけ、休戦の御沙汰書を発してもらう。
sen.e: He also officially announced the death of Iemochi, and approached to the Imperial Court to ask them to publish the imperial words documents of cease-fire.
He officially announced the death of Iemochi, and asked the Imperial Court to issue an imperial words document to call cease-fire.

sen.j: また慶喜の意を受けた勝海舟と長州の広沢真臣・井上馨が宮島で会談し停戦が行われた。
sen.e: Kaishu KATSU, who represented Yoshinobu, had a meeting with Saneomi HIROSAWA and Kaoru INOUE from Choshu in Miyajima, and they agreed to cease-fire.
Kaishu KATSU, on behalf of Yoshinobu, had a meeting with Saneomi HIROSAWA and Kaoru INOUE of the Choshu Domain in Miyajima, and they agreed on a cease-fire.
